newsitem.title: SWEDEN: FORECAST - SKF '96 profit to slip 27 pct.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - SKF '96 profit to slip 27 pct.

text.p: Swedish bearings maker SKF was expected on Thursday to post a lower profit after financial items for calendar 1996 of 2.43 billion crowns against 3.33 billion crowns in 1995, a Reuters poll of 16 analysts showed.
Forecasts varied between 2.22 billion and 2.69 billion crowns.
The average of 14 analysts' forecasts found expectations of a profit per share for 1996 of 13.20 crowns against 17.95 crowns in 1995.
The company was expected to propose a dividend payment of 5.32 crowns a share compared with 5.25 crowns in 1995.

Analysts interviewed for the poll were from Nordiska, Paribas, James Capel, Fischer, Swedbank, Handelsbanken, Enskilda, Foreningsbanken, Carnegie, Kleinwort Benson, Morgan Grenfell, Fiba Nordic, UBS, Goldman Sachs, Penser and Aros.
SKF will release its annual earnings on February 6.
